body_html:
As for scatter_update, sorry that I didn't check the doc on it. No, the current version will not implement

If indices contains duplicate entries, lexicographically later entries override earlier entries.

It'll be quite tricky to do that. Off the top of my head, I guess one can first sort then remove duplicates (or do a max). It'll be inefficient and is tailored to a case that probably won't be used. How about changing documentation?

body:
As for `scatter_update`, sorry that I didn't check the doc on it.  No, the current version will not implement

> If indices contains duplicate entries, lexicographically later entries override earlier entries.

It'll be quite tricky to do that.  Off the top of my head, I guess one can first sort then remove duplicates (or do a max).  It'll be inefficient and is tailored to a case that probably won't be used.  How about changing documentation?
